content: hey crafters welcome to the dance craft
I'm team Scotty good to have you with me today I am going to show you how to do a
gelatinous cube and I really don't want to take all the credit for this because
poster on my forum named the brave initially had this idea and I really
want to get a shout out to you because this was a cool idea in his idea he used
he actually used like a saran wrap bag bag and then like use some tape on it
I'm doing mine a little differently but essentially it's his same idea so I
really want to thank you for that post that was fantastic and I think this is a
really cool idea so let's go this to the table and I'll show you how to craft
that gelatinous cube so here's a piece of scrap paper and I
want to kind of show you what the idea for the cube so what I what you want to
do is make it like a square grid so you'll have okay so this will be the top
and this will be the side side side side and we're going to cut these pieces off
okay and then we'll bend these in okay and I'll show you how to do that at the
table but I want to show you the piece of plastic I took for the that I'm going
to use and it's a it's hard to see you might be able to see that scoring I did
on it I did it with an exacto knife and I just used my t-square to get to
measure that out and then score it with the exacto knife so now what I'm gonna
do is cut it out well I want to talk about the plastic itself for a sec this
plastic is a harder kind of plastic flexible plastic it's might be something
used for an overhead or some of those old sheet protectors the harder plastic
sheet protectors so this is what I'm using for this so let's let's cut that
out and then we'll move to the next step so I'll cut it out and then I end up
with it with a shape like this okay it's like a plus sign okay but I've scored
this the sheet so not only did it guide me to cut this out I can bend it along
that that score line much easier than if I try to just do it on my own
so see now it's okay so now I've got it fold it over and
it'll it'll form into a box like this basically is what we're going for so
let's do some detail detail work on this and then we'll move to the next step now
here I'm ready to apply some hot glue I want to get some texture now one thing I
did notice when I did it the first time was I made the box first and then
applied the texture which was a little more difficult so I think I might try to
apply most of the texture first and then then enclose the box so you might get
some warpage with this I did on my first one but it wasn't bad it kind of makes
it look like not just a perfect cube which is kind of nice you know it's cute
it's close to being a cube but not a perfect cube so we'll we'll start
applying the hot glue to this so I'm just going to kind of do some and I
don't want to get go right to the edge yet because then that will make it
difficult to fold over and just add some more so so give it some kind of a
gelatinous look all right see if you can see that all
right that's really cool so what we'll do is we'll do the rest of these sides
and then we'll assemble this now your instinct is going to be oh I
want to get this done but don't rush it let this glue dry out well
not dry out but you know get cool so you can touch it without pulling you know
the glue off and this is plenty cool so let it sit for a few minutes so now it's
ready to go so you can see the texture I got on there came out really nicely so
now that the next point is to assemble this I'm going to kind of Bend these
sides over and I'm trying to make a rough cube and these are just two by two
inch sides okay so now what I'm going to do is glue the side together so I'll
just use my hot glue get that edge and remember you don't have to be perfect
with this this is just and then just hold it until it bonds and now we'll
work our way around and do all the edges like this and I'll come back and show
you alright there we go our cube is assembled looking really nice but I want
to add a little more detail first and strength so what I'm gonna do is use my
smaller glue gun pull that back and then it gets just going to add some glue
along those inside edges where it connects the corners
now I'll give some reinforcement there okay so be careful you can with the hot
glue gun you can undo some of the seams you've done so be very careful with that
when you're doing it like I didn't Jam that the nozzle in and really you know
push it hard or anything I just just kind of zip up there so you don't you
don't undo those seams so let's let that harden up for a sec and then we'll do
we'll start doing the final detail on this this puppy
all right this is looking great but the square is a little too perfect so let's
grab our glue gun and we'll start kind of messing with those edges so what I'll
do is I'll just drag the blue gun over the edge and it'll kind of blend it into
the rest and this will give it a not so perfectly square shape so to look more
gelatinous and less plasticky okay so I'm going to run over all the edges like
that and then we'll be done and I'll show you what it looks like on the tile
so suppose our players are going along in the dungeon and they turn the corner
and they see this kind of room and you could have something to lure the players
in or something like that or you know you could just the Gillette you know
they may not see it immediately they're worth a shot in this cube could just you
know lunge out or come out and start rolling towards the players and they're
like oh crap and they got to run back you know and it's coming slow after them
so it goes down the hall so this basically fits in this two to across
hall and it just you know follows them down the hall and like they're trying to
get rid of it they gotta decide which way to go really quick or you know it's
going to gonna catch up to them so you can have that kind of stuff or you could
have like you know when they when they come up here and they they maybe see
treasure or something but don't see this and then they go in the room and they're
like attacked and you could actually put them inside the DES latinus cube which
is pretty fricken awesome and you can still see him inside of it so that's why
we didn't you know of course why we didn't do the bottom because you can put
the guys to put the people in there and that's what I really like about this
technique is that you can put guys inside so you know give you another
little closer look at the cube and you see the light just pouring through that
it's virtually cute it's virtually clear you know with that the hot glue and
there we go that's an easy and cheap gelatinous cube is you can actually put
